Time/CNN poll conducted by Harris International. Nov 18-19, 2003
 
 N=1,507 adults nationwide. MoE +/-2.5%(total sample)
 
 Question "Do you think that marriages between homosexual men or homosexual women should be recognized as legal by the law or not?
 
 Yes 32%
 No 62%
 Not Sure 6%

the reason why folks bash republicans for anti-gay intolerance and not democrats is relatively simple. Democrats don't make it part of their party platform. I'd be as upset with a democrat who opposed gay marriage as a republican. But even if 59% of dems. oppose it, i'd imagine that percentage is much higher for republicans.
 
 Oh, the other reason why republicans deserve a bit more yelling is because their opposition to gay marriage and/or civil unions is hypocritical and antithetical to their own core values. Theoretically, repubs believe in a limited government and free individual action. Regarding gay marriage, they wish to expand government into social dictates and restrict individual action on the grounds that it is to the overall benefit of society (or even worse, society "wants" it). Government enforcing social and/or behavorial norms? Hmm, sounds pretty authoritarian to me.
